question:
Consider the following statements about the National Young Leaders Programme (NYLP):
  1. The beneficiaries of the programme are the girls and boys in the age-group of 15-29 years
  2. Under this programme, National Youth Development Fund (NYDF) has been set up by the government to mobilise funds from non-budgetary resources for the beneficiaries
Which of the above statements is/are correct?
explanation: <u>First statement is correct</u>. The National Young Leaders Programme is a new central sector scheme. It was launched in 2014, with a view to developing leadership qualities among the youth (15-19 years of age as per National Youth Policy) to enable them to realize their full potential and in the process, to contribute to the nation-building process. The programme aims at motivating the youth (15-19 years of age) to strive for excellence in their respective fields and to bring them to the forefront of the development process. It seeks to harness the immense youth energy for nation-building. <u>Second statement is correct</u>. The National Development Fund has been set up under the aegis of National Young Leaders Programme with the objective to mobilise funds from non-budgetary resources also for youth development. This will enable the Department to fill the gaps in the ongoing programmes as also take up innovative programmes for youth development to create young leaders. The National Young Leaders Programme (NYLP) has five components: Neighbourhood Youth Parliament (NYP); Youth for Development Programme (YFDP); National Young Leaders Awards (NYLA); National Youth Advisory Council (NYAC); National Youth Development Fund (NYDF).
